availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Carter County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Frances Boggs. Married to Temperance Boggs. Father of James M. Boggs, Samantha S. Boggs, Hannah Boggs, Commodore Boggs, Peace Boggs, and Martha Boggs. Resident of Carter County in 1850. Farmer in Carter County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, District 1, p. 279A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, p. 275.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, Precinct 7, p. 159B.
Find A Grave, "Eilhu Boggs (1829-1881)," Memorial #25950279, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/2590279 (accessed January 16, 2020).
